definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: You have to use strength and skill to pound these long nails in.
sentences.chinese: 要敲进这些长钉子，你既得有力气，又得有技巧。

sentences.english: However, it would be a mistake to rest on our laurels .
sentences.chinese: 然而，这将是一个错误的休息满足于既得荣誉。

sentences.english: By contrast, rich nations suffer from deep sunk costs and entrenched vested interests.
sentences.chinese: 与之相比，富国将遭殃于深厚的隐没成本及既得利益。

sentences.english: Do not listen to this sophistry by vested interests.
sentences.chinese: 不要听信这些既得利益者的诡辩。

sentences.english: But drug companies have a vested interest in disease-mongering.
sentences.chinese: 但制药公司已经从制造疾病中获得了既得利益。

sentences.english: We have no vested interest in this respect.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这方面没有既得利益。

sentences.english: Dicey's theory of vested or acquired rights is based on the principle of territoriality .
sentences.chinese: 戴赛的“既得权说”以属地原则为基础。

definition: that being the case/then/in that case
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
